I guess I should still write here... but... no
I have a new LJ, visit - http://www.livejournal.com/users/katebone
No one commented on this one, but I have a lot of friends for my new one, so way!
Hm. Trombones rock, as always.
-Kat

Your Life: The Movie by mintyduck
Who will play you:Alyson Hannigan
Who will play your love interest:Colin Farrell

Song that will play during your love scene:Berlin - Sex (I'm a)
Song that will play during your death:Stevie Wonder - They Won't Go When I Go
Your name:
Created with quill18's MemeGen!
How perfect that Alyson Hannigan shall play another band geek. Hey, I know what you're thinking. I do nothing of the sort. I play valve-trombone (flugabone... ) Oh yes, I get to learn trumpet fingerings now! Why? Well, because my new valve-trombone, technically called a "flugabone" since it's wrapped up a bit like a flugelhorn, and yet it's in the pitch of an Alto Trombone, is a Bb instrument, thus making me learn to play it differently. Shouldn't be hard at all, though, considering that I have the fundementals down, I'll probably learn them in a day or so. I'll just make a correspondance chart for myself or something. I've been practicing trombone a lot lately, and I did this impovisation excersize...and finally, my tone just...got good. By God, though, it was amazing! Hah, I sound stupid, don't I? Well, I'm not, I did the most lovely improvizational peice when looking at a peice of artwork. Theres a website called: http://www.trombonelessons.com where it has a creativity excersize, and I played as I've never played before. I'm not even sure what I did play, but it sure did sound good when it was coming out. Good and loud. :D :D :D We've gotten our Christmas music in band. Ugh...lame Christmas music. We can't even jazz up "The Christmas Song" because we're doing it with the choir. Gag. We have one festival peice too, and the second trombone part sucks. It's a brass quartet empasis in Mozart's Allelujah. Yep, and you guessed it, I'm not in the quartet. Therefore...I have 65 measures of rest, and 4 measures of playing... Yay, at least I can get some knitting done. Jazz Band was interesting...considering that we couldn't DO anything. Yes, the substitute teacher came 5 minutes within the start of the first period (Jazz Band is a zero period) and we just sat in the hall talking and wondering where the sub was until finally we had Faulkner (econ. teacher) unlock both the band rooms for us. A few people played Critical Mass, and I sat and stared at them because there was only 10 minutes anyway. Besides, choir girls began to file into the regular band room (why don't they ever go into the Jazz Band/Choir room??) and we just gave up on it. Hah, what happened in things other than band, you ask? What is there other than band? Wow, it's 11pm...I should begin getting ready for bed. Have a nice night.
-Kat
 Oy, and now I'm going to sleep.

Why are you in band
brought to you by Quizilla Haha, I just took another quiz. Sorry, haven't written in a while, I've been updating this, though: http://www.freeopendiary.com/entrylist.asp?authorcode=A887240 Funny, I usually don't really update it. Hmm...I'm sick today. That's crap, eh? Oh well. -Kat

Today was un-endearing.
It was cool, then it was stupid, then it was cool, then it was really stupid...from there...it just got stupider.
This morning, as usual, I DID NOT want to wake up to go to band camp (it's a day camp sorta) and I lie there and groaned about my sunburn FROM band camp (ok, and the festival...mostly from the festival, actually) and my loss of appitite that I've had for, like two days (I've only eaten an odwalla drink and a pop-sickle...oh, and that icky band-camp donut...though I only ate half of it) and this huge stomach ache that I had...then I got up, got dressed (slowly, because cotton hurts against second degree burns) put on my shoes, slowly (because converse hurt against zillions of puss filled blisters) took off converse because they suck, and put on mary-janes which STILL hurt.
Then I got yelled at by my mum because I pointed out that Stephy D. and I CANNOT be late to band.
ROAR!
Then blah, blah. We were at school, and we got in the band room, and I put down my huge trombone case. And put on my sunglasses, and got my drill book (well, drill papers stapled together), and my flip-folder and went out to practice <u>THE FIELD SHOW.</u>
Then it really began to suck, because low brass...and low brass only (because we carry the melody of the songs blah blah blah...) get to march with legs up at 45 degree angles... you really have to see us doing this to believe it. I'd laugh if I weren't doing it too.
Then...scavenger hunt...sucks...arrgh. Our campus is HUGE...literally as big as two normal sized high-schools combined. But, we sprinted around campus in already sweaty clothes (uggh...I was wearing my stupid red capris...which suck) collecting stupid clues (Meat-Head Headquarters, Old Rifle Range???) which we got stupider clues from other sections that were racing us to get all their clues before we got ours (Cassidy doing something stupid with his arms was supposed to signify weight-lifting...which signifies dumb jocks... O_O) we eventually got to the end of it. Not with out a proper amount of bitching and moaning, and me getting in trouble by David and the drum-major for sprinting ahead, of course. But we got out.
And what was our wonderful lunch prize but... bologna sandwitches? BOLOGNA SANDWITCHES!??!?! I'm a VEGATARIAN.
Damnit.
Well, that's all my bitching and moaning for today. I'm only chosing not to mention the good things about today because I'm tired, pissed, and achy...
Leave a comment...for once.
-/<@!

W00t! Band lock-in on fiday! Heh, heh... I'm so nerdy. I get to sleep over in the new band room! And watch Monty Python! (I think..)
Haven't written in a while... but... W-JULIET WAS DISCOVERED BY ME, AND I LOVES IT!!!!! Not more than Hanakimi though. I can't love anything more than Hanakimi. Ever.
Mmm...I'm so busy...I shouldn't be screwing off on the internet...oh well!
-/<@!

My bottom lip hurts. I just bit really hard into it, which makes me incapable of practicing trombone for a little while...so I figured that I might just write in my livejournal about all the little things I was too tired to write about before. First of all, for band, the songs are really good. Americans We, especially, it's stuck in my head right now, even though I'm trying to drown it out with j-pop (I don't want to become fully tired of it before I have to...) I still haven't seen the new band room, I guess we can't see it until band camp. David Duwelle snuck up into it to see what it looked like, though. It's on the top floor, and I guess it's a lot bigger and cooler, and seperate from the choir room. This makes me happy as a clam. Big classrooms are awesome, I was knocking into everyone the other day in the old band room. You can't even move in there...too many music stands and people in one tiny space. I'm eating cherry pie right now, it's good. :D I'm kind of stoked, because we have pizza for dinner, even though everything I eat hurts my lip, it still tastes good. I hope it's not too swolen. I guess I can play my trombone anyway, though. I'm really just lazy, and lack the mental capabilities of practicing anything at this moment in time. Anyway, I met this really cool freshman named Sarah at the music reading, she plays the bass guitar, and she looks like Vanessa Carlton. Stephy D. was stoked over her guitar strap, it was all cool and studded. Her bass was cool too, even though she didn't think so. I called her a slacker since her bass means she'll be in the pit, she doesn't have to worry about right or left! On Monday, when we were marching, I actually bit my left thumb (which is now being kind of wierd and spastic...O_o) to remember my left from my right. I'm such a wierdo. However, I'm pleased to announce that it is very effective, and I do know right from left now... Uggh, it's so freaking hot. I haven't worked on my comic since last week, I really should if I plan on meeting my deadline, since I just discovered that I have no month of August anymore... since: a.) starting from August 1st, I'm staying in Colerado for a week b.) directly afterward, band camp starts c.) immediately after band camp ends, school starts... O_o GRRR...deadlines! They suck! Stephy D. informs me that www.arrrgh-matey.com has been purchased. That is good news to www.geekular.org, since she probably will no longer have the hastle of hosting my sorry butt after that. (Heh, my bandwidth use is probably killing her right now...) I'm going to go attempt to practice even though my lip is roughly the size of one of jupiter's moons right now... Catchya later!
~K@!

LJ Barcode
LJ username:

I am now band geeky. Feel my wrath. And our fall season of marching songs is stuck in my head...particularly Oye Como Va...
Oye Como Va! Da-da-da! Oye Como Va! Ai!
Hehe...twas fun. I'll update more when I'm not dead.
I need to practice trombone anyway....
/<@!

You are Love. You love life, you love all those around you and
the world that you live in. You are happiest
when you are doing something for someone else
or for the common good of mankind.

Oh wow, my teeth are so shiny and white now that I use an electric toothbrush! I feel so rejuvinated! I'm also going to the band orientation tomarrow! Whee...I really can't wait...this way I get to meet all the freshman! I hope there are some nice ones! (Oh, and maybe some cute ones...I know, I'm such a cradle-robber!!)
I'm wearing a really cute outfit tomarrow too! (I'm so shallow! Clothes, clothes, clothes! I like to be unique about them though, and not trendy, so that's good, right?) anyway, I have this cute flowy mini-skirt with little tiny roses on it, and this pink sequined top from Charlotte Russe with baggy knee-socks (like the ones japanese school-girls wear, they're really cute, I found some in a drawer!) and my black "sporty" Mary-Janes... I really want my hair cut tomarrow, and my nails done too! It would be awesome... I just don't know, though!
I'm thinking of getting my hair even shorter this time, and I wan't strawberry blonde highlights! And there was a thingie in Gals! on one of the author notes that had all sorts of different styles of nails she gets. Most girls at school get french manicures, but I so want something different!
Anyway, the style idea was light green with loads of pink jewels, and since that would match my outfit perfectly tomarrow, I really want my nails like that!!
Oh, I'll just have to tell my mum to bring me with her as she gets her nails done, that way I can get mine done too!
Yay! Fun for all!
Anyway, I gotta go, it's nearly 11pm, and I still gotta do loads of stuff...
^_^ Love Ya! xoxoxox!
-Kat

You are Haneoka Meimi

You are athletic and determined, though not necessarily the best of students. You have a strong sense of justice and are always willing to help those in need. You love to joke around, and have tons of friends. Though you love a good chase, you never like to get caught.

Take the "What Magic Girl are you?" Quiz Another quiz today, oh-ho-ho! I don't think I was too surprized with this answer... Hmmm... I'm a pretty good student, though, so what the heck? I am athletic...and I joke around a lot...but still... Hmmm... Oh well! Reading a manga called GALS! right now, at first I didn't like it, but now I love it! It's so different! Trying to download the next one off IRC...I should go to the bookstore sometime and aquire some Saint Tail or Miracle Girls, speaking of which... I need to start a new series ... on paper ... scanslations are beginning to rule my life. Yea, trombone will soon, though. I'm getting mine Tuesday, and I'm getting my hair cut super-short... Blah. Might go to the ocean next weekend... ROAR. I'm hungry. Eep.

I wish I weren't allergic to strawberries! They are one of the cutest fruits in the world! And I love the flavor too, although even with the aid of allergy pills I become instantly sick...
At least I can eat pancakes. Pan-cakes, fresh cherries, cinnamon, mint chocolate icecream, and apple muffins rule the world. And fuddish (a blender made drink made by Stephy D., Janet, or myself. See past entries for recipe...wait, YOU can't make it, only WE can, bwhaha!)
Anyway, I guess I can live without strawberries...I guess...
My fourth of july outfit is truly key, by the way! It consists of:
Deep cherry-red knit tie front cap-sleeve shirt
Blue knee-length paisly skirt
Pink sparkly loop belt worn oddly over hips
Light pink baggy knee socks
Red and blue adidas
Big red sparkly raver-esque jewlery

Heehee, I feel hyper... I'm only drinking orange juice too...heehee...
Oyy...

Things that most make me happy:

1. Having a movie marathon that consists of Hayao Miyazaki movies, Amelie, and Ever After.
2. Reading new Hanakimi or Marmalade Boy
3. Eating chicken ramen with chop-sticks
4. Walking across the beach barefoot on a cold day
5. Getting a warm hug
6. Listening to trumpets play loudly
7. Brushing my hair when I first cut it chin length
8. Adding honey to mandarin orange tea
9. Figuring out an algebra equation
10. Star gazing
11. Capturing a moment and closing your eyes and spinning around
12. Writing about it later
13. Pretending I'm good at playing my instruments
14. Smelling cinnamon muffins baking
15. Watching the sun come up on the porch in P.J.'s
16. Making Jell-o
17. Walking slowly after breaking your own mile record running
18. Running towards the goal with the soccer-ball with no interference
19. Wearing evening gowns that fit perfectly
20. Enhaling the scent of a single sunflower

...mmm, listening to Ayumi Hamasaki, pretending I actually understand it... live really is nice.
Happy July 4th!

Byeh, haven't written in a while...however, over the period of time, I have spent about $400-$500 dollars! Yay! Stuff: Hot pink jelly platform shoes Pink low-rise pants Pink sparkly belt Pink sequin "Flowy" shirt (reminds me of Cardcaptor Sakura) Cardcaptor Sakura: Master of the Clow Volumes 1 & 2 (where are the next ones?!!!?!?) Hanakimi Volume 1-10 (yeeee!) Amelie (on dvd) Legally Blonde (on dvd) New shiny sunglasses Best friend's necklaces (childish, but key...) White Stripes - Elephant (cd) Ayumi Hamazaki (cd) 90 CD Holder Clear jelly bracelets with sparkles (heart...) LOTS OF HELLO-KITTY PENS!!!! (Sanrio store=joy.) Hanakimi rocks!!!!! I am soooo happy I am reading it (Sano is sexy...and he's anime...O_O *dies*) So, now I'm a happy camper... and you?

~KAT

These are boring...but what the hell! T H E B A S I C S : Name: Kat... Birth date: May 2, 1987 Birthplace: New Orleans, Louisiana Current Location: Foresthill, California Eye Color: Ocean Blue-ish with Grey speckles... Hair Color: Dirt Brown :P Height: 5'5 3/4" Righty or Lefty: Ambidextrous Zodiac Sign: Taurus A B O U T Y O U : Your heritage: Irish, French, Scottish, English. The shoes you wore today: Orange flip-flops Your weakness: Hot guys... Your fears: Not many at this moment. Your perfect pizza: All cheese, with stuffed crust cheese....ooooo Goal you'd like to achieve: Become a good trombonist P E R S O N A L I T Y : Your most overused phrase on AIM: "Poot." Your thoughts first waking up: "It seems like it's going to be a good day!" Your bedtime: Whenever I'm tired Your most missed memory: If I missed it, it wouldn't be a memory, now would it? E I T H E R / O R : Pepsi or Coke: Orange soda. McDonald's or Burger King: Only when faced with the decision of either that or capitol punishment. Single or group dates: Either/or. It's not like I'm Miss Date-Girl... Adidas or Nike: Adidas are more comfortable to run in... Ice Tea or Nestea: Ice Tea! Chocolate or vanilla: Vanilla, definitely... Cappuccino or coffee: *drools* Vanilla cappuccino... H A B I T S : Smoke: Smoking is bad. Cuss: Damn it. You got me there, asshole. Sing: Constantly. Take a shower everyday: Usually. Have a crush: O_O Do you think you've been in love: No, not really, just crushed...all...the...time... Want to go to college: Fashion design, or Beauty school. Liked high school: Yep! Want to get married: Sure. Believe in yourself: Yes, I do, in fact. Get motion sickness: O_O Think you're attractive: Are you kidding? I'm a sexy beast! Rawr! Think you're a health freak: *snorts* Think you're a clean freak: YES! Goodness-gracious, yes! Get along with your parent(s): Sometimes. Like thunderstorms: Not really. Play an instrument: Flute, Violin, soon Trombone... H A V E Y O U : In the past month have you... Drank alcohol: No Smoked: No Done a drug: No Had Sex: No Made Out: No, but I've been kissed... Gone on a date: No Gone to the mall?: No, but I will... Eaten an entire box of Oreos: No Been on stage: Yes, in fact I have. Been dumped: I'm beginning to look like a loser here. Gone skating: No Made homemade cookies: Yep Gone skinny dipping: x_x Dyed your hair: No Stolen anything: No H A V E Y O U E V E R : Played a game that required removal of clothing: Oh dear is me! (yes...truth or dare...x_x) If so, was it mixed company: Yes...x_x Been trashed or extremely intoxicated: No Been caught "doing something": No! Been called a tease: No Gotten beaten up: No Shoplifted: No Changed who you were to fit in: No, actually, I haven't. T H E F U T U R E : Age you hope to be married: When I'm in love. Numbers and Names of Children: 2, Madison (boy, I've decided I like that name for a boy), and Lucielle or Virginia. Describe your Dream Wedding: In a country place, on a bridge over a creak, surrounded by flowers and falling leaves in autumn or summer. A yellow dress. How do you want to die: Laughing. Wenn ist das nunstruck git un slotermeyer! Ja! Beirhund das oderdie flipperwaldt gershput! (mwhaha, Monty Python fans will only get this...) Where you want to go to college: Where-ever... What do you want to be when you grow up: Fashion designer with a lot of free time. What country would you most like to visit: Ireland, or Japan. T H E B O Y S : In a guy.. Best eye color? Green, Blue, Brown, all of them, doesn't matter... Best hair color? As long as he's cute. I guess blonde is nice. Short or long hair: Whatever. Height: At least 5'5" Best weight: Whatever goes. Best articles of clothing: He has to have nice shoes. Best first date location: Anywhere not tacky. Best first kiss location: Under the stars! (Not in my drive-way, or in a Library... -_-) T H E N U M B E R S : # of people I could trust with my life: do I really trust anyone with my life? About 4 of them. # of CDs that I own: 87 # of piercings: 2 # of tattoos: 0 # of scars on my body: Zillions O_O # of things in my past that I regret: I try not to regret, only to think ahead.
~KAT

Yesterday the lake was fun...Amy's brother is soooo annoying...I could have strangled him half the time... But I did have fun all in all. Today = father's day, though. Therefore, I cleaned the (then disgusting, now spotless) kitchen, did the laundry, washed eons of dishes, vacuumed all the rugs (O_o), made him lunch, cleaned my own room, watered mum's zillions of plants (that was fun, though) and played my flute for him. It was such a long time all of it...so now...I'm pooped. Listening to music...that's all...and eating cheez-its...grr...dad's calling...must go, write later about my magnificent adventures........ Love,
~KAT

I was looking for one of my old bikinis since I'm going to sugar pine, and I found so freaking many that my mum just gave me for no apparent reason. Some of them are from when I was a seventh grader (yes, I was brave enough way back then...) and I began to get nostagic about seventh grade. It's hard to believe that I'm now a sophomore in high school. Seventh grade seems really distant...but not that long ago. I first moved here in seventh grade, and it was such a wierd experience...and now all my best friends are from here, and were all in high school, the people I used to know too (I moved to a town right next to the old one, and there is no high school in my new town, so we go to the one all my old school-mates go to) and, anyway, people I know now and people I knew then are friends...it's just...wierd... Well, after that, I finally found one that looks good, it has bright turquoise and green checkers and flowers on it. I'm wearing some green checkered boxers and a white sleevless hood vest on top of it. I wear so much green, even more green then I wear yellow. I suppose turqiouse looks good with my eyes, and that's why. Oh, shit. I hope I have some sunglasses... Well, anyway, later days, my mum just came home and I want to take a shower, etc... Love Y'all!
~KAT

1 cup of ice 1 cup of milk a lot of chocolate syrup 1 blender (not broken) Put everything in blender and make fuddish. (c) copyright Kat and Stephy D. (sorry, just felt like posting)
~KAT

Amy, Katie, her little brother, his girlfriend, and I all are going to the lake tomarrow...finally some refreshment after being trapped in this air-tight box...my arm hurts like nothing else, though... It's confirmed, Stephy D. and I are going to the mall, and spending all day there next week, too... :D Cool, eh? Anyway...I'll write a longer one later I want to practice flute......see ya!

~KAT

Well, of course now that I've had my supplementary 4 hours of sleep, I'm up and ready! And I've just watched two hours of subtitled CardCaptor Sakura!!! Eeeep! It's sooo cute! Anyway, I am just dying to swim even though it's not that warm here for some stupid reason...my town is too near the Sierras... I've decided that I don't really need to diet...I'm whacked for even thinking that I should...I was looking at myself, and all of the sudden I was like "wait, aren't I a size six?" and that confirmed the fact that I can still un-guiltily eat ice cream. :D My mum got really mad at the BBQ last night, it was kind of amusing, she tried to get it started and it kept not working...she was using a can of empty lighter fluid and FORCING drops out of the poor can, and then the can caught on fire, so she blew it out, and found pine-needles. The pine-needles didn't aid the burning of the poor idiotic coal anymore than the empty bottle of lighter fluid...so I went in giggling and had a bagel for dinner. Jeez, I've been eating a lot of bagels lately... Hmmm... Ok, now I'll go practice my flute, wish I had my trombone already, etc... Loves,
~KAT
P.S. I like Stroke 9 better every time I listen to their cd!

Oh dear, I just scored 47.92899% - Super Geek... *bites nails* is this bad?
~KAT

I just stayed up all night so, I'm naturally just a little bit...lasjkhftu9u43jgngs/gmsfdj...if you know what I mean. I'm going to write in my new LJ until about 4:00 am when I can actually do something productive. Other people are in my house, so it's not like I can be a night-walker, and eat or something. And speaking of eating...I could really go for a blueberry bagel and some soy milk right now. We have blueberry bagels and soy milk, but again, I don't want to wander outside my room. It's weird, I don't even have a job yet for this summer. I wish I had a job. Stephy D. has a job. ROAR! Why don't I have a job?! (I know this, I'm just avoiding putting it in print in fear that it will jinx me.) It's been summer since Thursday (a week ago!) so I guess I'm not expected to be that thoroughly productive yet, but still. I feel so bored already... And what will I do tomorrow? NOTHING! Today? NOTHING! I wish that I could finally go to the mall with Stephy D., I'm itching for new stuff, and I have approx. $160 that burns a hole. After I get a job there will be no more of this not buying stuff at the mall and being broke riff-raff. Notice that true to my username, I'm being optimistic. Hmmm, I was practicing my flute today and it was marvelous, I actually cite read adequately! Go me! Now, I must be able to do this on trombone, and I'm all set for the multiple band classes I'm taking next year! ^_~ I need to have some summer reading projects (I mean other from my horrible A.P. Euro summer homework and Accelerated Eng. crap...) I wish I had access to a bookstore, but since I live in Hicksville, and the only reason I'm usually around and about is my open campused high school, I'm sitting here re-reading books...a lot. Stephy D. must give me books. Or Stephy D. will go to the mall with me. Only Stephy D. because were about the same size, though, and I wont be forced into weird stores that my other friends like going to. Wait, why would I know where my other friends go shopping? It's not like I've been shopping in the last century...haat. List of stuff I need: Flute music book Amelie on DVD Feather boa Fabric Books That Camisole from A&F...it's adorable even though it's from my least favorite store in the world Sandals that will be decent for marching practice @ band camp... Sunglasses I'll probably end up with about...oh...two of those things from that list. This summer is far too cold for my liking. I go outside and I CAN wear sweat-pants, and ice cold water on my feet ISN'T appetizing, what is that? I'm supposed to be dead from heat-stroke by now! And all I have to show is a lousy sun-burn! And why I even have a sunburn, and since it's being so overcast that's beyond me. I really should go downstairs and have something to eat...at about six o'clock. I'll bet my parents thought I went to bed. Little do they know...little do they know. I think later I'm going to watch some good and subtitled CCS. It's been a long time since I've been cute-ified, then maybe I'll ask my dad to rent Happenstance. I do so love Audrey Tautou movies. And Legally Blonde. I wish I had both of those movies. I think my life would be ... no different... but oh well. You know, I really love playing the flute. I practiced for a nice amount of time today. It made one of those memories, I was so happy. In my mind there is always a snatch of a wonderful time somewhere...ahh...herusement je vive! Wow. O_O Sooooo...wired...you all are going to read this entry, and go... "damn...she really was pulling an all-nighter!" All the same, I'm getting too much sleep lately. I mean, Jiminy Cricket! Sleeping in until noon?! This best no keep up since Jazz Band is 0 period next year... *_* Ah, well, I'm even beginning to bore myself with this entry, so I think I'll just say...au revoir!
~KAT
